title: Wing Luke Museum Affiliated Area: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons      HoursTuesday-Sunday: 10am-5pmMonday: ClosedFirst Thursday of the month: 10am-8pmFor information about holiday closures, visit www.wingluke.org. ToursGuided tours of a historic hotel and the Chinatown-International District neighborhood are offered daily. Advanced tickets are recommended and can be purchased online.Historic Hotel Tour – follow the footsteps of Asian Pacific American pioneers and explore the places they called home. Step inside a real 1910 shop that sold import goods and tickets to the Blue Funnel Line steamship. And enter an authentic Chinese American family association with its original tin ceilings and mahjong games. This tour takes you through fascinating historic spaces accessible only by guided tour.Neighborhood Walking Tour – discover Seattle's Chinatown-International District through the eyes of a local. Smell the fragrance of Chinese herbs, hom bows and roasted duck. Experience the sights while learning about the facts, myths and legends. And learn more about the diverse contributions of Asian cultures to the city and the Pacific Northwest.Private and group tours may be customized and should be reserved in advance. Visit the Wing Luke Museum's website for information about special seasonal tour offerings and upcoming events.
